{{cpp/regex/match_results/title|position}}
{{cpp/regex/match_results/navbar}}
{{ddcl|since=c++11|
difference_type position( size_type n {{=}} 0 ) const;
}}

Returns the position of the first character of the specified sub-match.

If {{c|1=n == 0}}, the position of the first character of the entire matched expression is returned.

If {{c|n &gt; 0 &amp;&amp; n &lt; size()}}, the position of the first character of the {{c|n}}{{sup|th}} sub-match is returned.

if {{c|1=n &gt;= size()}}, a position of the first character of the unmatched match is returned.

{{cpp/precondition|{{rlpf|ready}} must be {{c|true}}.}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|n|integral number specifying which match to examine}}
{{par end}}

===Return value===
The position of the first character of the specified match or sub-match.

===Example===
{{example
|code=
#include &lt;iostream&gt;
#include &lt;regex&gt;
#include &lt;string&gt;

int main()
{
    std::regex re("a(a)*b");
    std::string target("aaab");
    std::smatch sm;

    std::regex_match(target, sm, re);
    std::cout &lt;&lt; sm.position(1) &lt;&lt; '\n';
}
|output=
2
}}
